item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, November 4, 2024 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Alonzo Church: The Forgotten Architect of Computer Intelligence (72 points | 18 comments)
2. What should a logo for NeXT look like? (1986) (61 points | 22 comments)
3. Manjaro Linux prepares to enable telemetry by default (10 points | 1 comment)
4. New York Times tech workers go on strike (237 points | 410 comments)
5. It's Called a Dance Floor (26 points | 12 comments)
6. Tamarind Bio (YC W24) is hiring a founding engineer to scale bioML infra (SF) ( | hide)
7. Getting lost and found in the Bob Dylan archives (17 points | 1 comment)
8. Cheap Thrills, an album cover by Robert Crumb (2020) (130 points | 62 comments)
9. Scientists glue two proteins together, driving cancer cells to self-destruct (542 points | 134 comments)
10. Limitations of Frame Pointer Unwinding (81 points | 57 comments)
11. The history of Unix's ioctl and signal about window sizes (80 points | 19 comments)
12. Rewrite it in Rails (11 points | 1 comment)
13. Quincy Jones has died (131 points | 28 comments)
14. The Secret of Ramsey Numbers (32 points | 1 comment)
15. An embarrassingly simple approach to recover unlearned knowledge for LLMs (209 points | 95 comments)

17. Hertz-dev, the first open-source base model for conversational audio (237 points | 43 comments)
18. Unfortunate things about performance reviews (2021) (70 points | 31 comments)

20. Scalable watermarking for identifying large language model outputs (42 points | 22 comments)

22. Touchscreens are out, and tactile controls are back (1150 points | 796 comments)

25. Scientists Document Lost Mountain Cities on Silk Road in Uzbekistan (10 points | 1 comment)
26. A Hamiltonian Circuit for Rubik's Cube (92 points | 29 comments)
27. pg_flo – Stream, transform, and re-route PostgreSQL data in real-time (221 points | 43 comments)
28. The Submerged Nabataean Temple in Puteoli at Pozzuoli, Italy (70 points | 29 comments)
29. Programming languages that blew my mind (2023) (321 points | 179 comments)
30. I've had a change of heart regarding employee metrics (448 points | 276 comments)
